{{title|Namespace aliases}}
{{cpp/language/declarations/navbar}}

Namespace aliases allow the programmer to define an alternate name for a namespace.  

They are commonly used as a convenient shortcut for long or deeply-nested namespaces.

===Syntax===
{{sdsc begin}}
{{sdsc|num=1|
{{ttb|namespace}} {{spar|alias_name}} {{=}} {{spar|ns_name}}{{ttb|;}}
}}
{{sdsc|num=2|
{{ttb|namespace}} {{spar|alias_name}} {{=}} {{ttb|::}}{{spar|ns_name}}{{ttb|;}} 
}}
{{sdsc|num=3|
{{ttb|namespace}} {{spar|alias_name}} {{=}} {{spar|nested_name}}{{ttb|::}}{{spar|ns_name}}{{ttb|;}}
}}
{{sdsc end}}

===Explanation===

The new alias {{spar|alias_name}} provides an alternate method of accessing {{spar|ns_name}}.  

{{spar|alias_name}} must be a name not previously used.  {{spar|alias_name}} is valid for the duration of the scope in which it is introduced.

===Keywords===
{{ltt|cpp/keyword/namespace}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
namespace foo
{
    namespace bar
    {
         namespace baz
         {
             int qux = 42;
         }
    }
}
 
namespace fbz = foo::bar::baz;
 
int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; fbz::qux &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
42
}}
